title: About the RADS error
body:
So my friend and I were scouring the forums for this error and we came across something that actually worked so here is what we did. 

If you go into the area that you downloaded league you will find the League of legends folder and if you browse into that folder you will see RADS follow these steps in order.

Browse to hard drive with league installed > League of Legends > RADS > projects > league_client > releases > 0.0.0.92 > deploy > scroll down until you find libcurl.dll and you will see that it has no data stored with it so that is the broken one right there, delete the file and browse back to the League of Legends folder, then copy the libcurl.dll that does have data stored with it and paste it into the 0.0.0.92 deploy folder and then try to boot league up again and everything should work smoothly. If anyone else has any recommendations I will add them to this post when I see them.

-Itaniindahood


EDIT: So upon this new patch the files libcrypto-1_1.dll, libssl-1_1.dll, and zlib.dll all break and you have to follow the same steps but the files that aren't broken have changed positions. The files that aren't broken are going to be found in the deploy folder of the folder 0.0.0.92 and then you just copy them and paste them into the league of legends folder by replacing the ones with the same name in that folder. I will continue to update this patch by patch adding the files that need to be fixed and where to find the ones that aren't broken. Hopefully Riot will fix this soon and this thread will be come irrelevant, but until then keep checking back if your RADS folder or league of legends folder breaks you will most likely find your fix on this thread if not somewhere else! See ya on the rift!

replies.body: This could possibly help, but I wanted to add a little bit more context as well. The quickest fix for these RADS errors is typically to setup your [**permissions**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) again. Giving this a try could be worth a try as well if permissions don't seem to help!
